page.title: 19LUNCHTIME SURVEY AT A PUB.
page.content: The landlord said that they did not have many lunchtime customers because of the drink-drive law. Of the handful of people who were at the Cottage,only three were local.The locals went in two or three times a week.One traveller said he called in "sometimes",another 3 times a month. The reasons they gave for choosing the Cottage were:(i) it was local;(ii)they served good food;and (iii)because it was near to work. The most popular lunch was ham, egg and chips.This cost them Â£1.30. There was a computer operator,2 who worked in the motortrade and a company manager. There was a retired lady too. They drank cider and lager,shandy and straight lager and bitter. Some of them had their food and drink in the beer garden. The landlady cooked the meals.
